messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] All Round Magazine
messages.msgSnippet: Kristin, My ds (11.9) is about to publish his first website (the address will be aliencomix.com when I get around to purchasing the domain) Part of his site is
messages.messageBody:
Kristin,

My ds (11.9) is about to publish his first website (the address will be aliencomix.com when I get around to purchasing the domain)

Part of his site is a gallery of kids art. If your daughter would like to be the first artist, my son would honored. His address is ben@...

Jeanne

----- Original Message -----
From: Mark Shields
To: 'unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com'
Sent: Thursday, July 15, 2004 21:36
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] All Round Magazine


Does everyone know about All Round Magazine? It's a beautiful hand-drawn
magazine which only comes out twice a year, but is worth the wait. We've
subscribed for a few years and are always amazed by the new issue. Another
big plus is that every submission my dd has made has been published. If
you have a child who is forever disappointed to not have a letter or
drawing published in a magazine like Spider or Ranger Rick you'll see what
a plus this is. I do not have any other connection to the magazine other
than being a subscriber, but since we just got our latest issue today I
thought I'd mention it. My dd also has a drawing in this issue and she is
so excited.

www.allroundmagazine.com

They even have links on the website for unschooling- very cool!!
Kristin

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] All Round Magazine
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/15/2004 9:39:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time, shields@oldshoepress.com writes: Does  everyone know about All Round Magazine?   It s a
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/15/2004 9:39:57 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
shields@... writes:

Does everyone know about All Round Magazine? It's a beautiful hand-drawn
magazine which only comes out twice a year, but is worth the wait. <<<

It is a beautiful magazine!

We're looking forward to this next issue----maybe tomorrow? Great!

I highly recommend it too. I usually keep an issue in my bag when I'm out &
about. I can hand it to a mom with a small fidgety child and they can look
through it together rather than get more fidgety (child) and angrier (mom).

~Kelly




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
